thread.title: Kidderminster Harriers appoint Dave Hockaday as new head coach
thread.title_full: Kidderminster Harriers appoint Dave Hockaday as new head coach

title: Kidderminster Harriers appoint Dave Hockaday as new head coach
text:
Tweet 
The 57 year-old will take charge of the team with immediate effect and will be in the dugout for Saturday’s lunchtime kick-off against Macclesfield Town. 
Dave is regarded as one of the most accomplished coaches in the country, having founded the first ever football academy, in Cirencester in 1995. Its overwhelming success over the following four years earned Dave a move to Watford, where he worked as U18 coach at the turn of the millennium. 
Under his stewardship, the club unearthed some of Watford’s biggest names, including current England and Manchester United winger, Ashley Young. Promoted to Watford’s first-team as a coach in 2005, he was part of the staff that clinched promotion to the Premier League a year later. What do you think? Log in and start commenting 
Dave went on to hold coaching roles at the likes of Southampton before taking the managerial reins at Forest Green Rovers where, in a four year spell, oversaw the development of a team that went from perennial strugglers to genuine promotion contenders. 
After leaving Rovers he later managed at Leeds United before coaching with Coventry City where he also spent a spell as caretaker boss. Related stories:
